alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 10 at 5:10AM PST until March 10 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: The National Weather Service in Los Angeles/Oxnard has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern San Luis Obispo County in southwestern California... * Until 100 PM PST Friday. * At 510 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen in many areas, with local amounts upwards of 7 inches over the mountains. Additional rainfall amounts of 4 to 8 inches are possible in the warned area, as heavy rain persists through the day. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cambria, Point Piedras Blancas, Hearst Castle and Lake Nacimiento. This also includes the Highway 1 in northwest San Luis Obispo County. THIS HAS THE POTENTIAL TO BECOME AN ESPECIALLY DANGEROUS FLOODING SITUATION BY LATE THIS MORNING. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
